entry.title: CheatSheet for Vim Key Bindings
entry.summary:
Vim Key Bindings CheatSheet
Vim Modes: There are three modes. It’s used for the following:
Normal Mode: Movement, deletion and searching Insert Mode: Entering text directly Visual: Manipulating text using selection
Movement: 1. Basic navigations h -> left j -> down k -> up l -> right gg -> first line of page G -> last line of page :number -> specified line number ...

entry.title: Neovim Init Setup
entry.summary:
Neovim Neovim is a cli based text editor written in lua. It’s written in lua and is based on vim.
Use :q! to quit or :wq to write & quit btw.
Installation on Mac #Using HomeBrew brew install neovim
#Verify the Installation nvim -v
Configuring Package Manager #Setting up lazy.nvim mkdir ~/.config/nvim && touch ~/.config/nvim/init.lua echo 'require("config.lazy")' >> ~/.co...

entry.title: Jekyll Installation on Mac
entry.summary:
Jekyll is used to convert your markdown notes into a static site. This blog was created by converting my Obsidian notes written as .md and converting them to a static site using Jekyll.
Setting up Jekyll on Mac using Homebrew:
# Install chruby (Version Manager) and ruby-install (Package Manager) brew install chruby ruby-install
# Check the latest Ruby Version: https://jekyllrb.com/docs/insta...

entry.title: CheatSheet for Markdown
entry.summary:
Markdown CheatSheet
1. Typography:
# H1 ## H2 ###### H6
*italics* or _italics_ **bold** ~~strike~~
2. URL & Lists:
[Click Me](example.com "tooltip here")
1. Ordered Item 1 1. Ordered Item 2
* Unordered Item 1 * Unordered Item 2
List Example:
Click Me
Ordered Item 1 Ordered Item 2
unordered list item 1
unordered list item 2
3. Code & Syntax Hig...
